title: How to Make a Skillet Cookie

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 325° Fahrenheit (162° Celsius).
Melt the butter.
steps.description: In an iron skillet, melt the butter on medium-high heat, stirring around with a rubber spatula. Continue to stir until it fully melts and bubbles slightly.

steps.headline: Pour both sugars and stir.
steps.description: Mix until the mixture is glossy and smooth, resembling melted caramel.

steps.headline: Shut off the stove and chill the mixture in the fridge until cool.
steps.description: Allow the mixture to chill for about 10-15 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove the mixture from the fridge and crack in the eggs.
Stir in the vanilla, baking soda, flour, and salt.
steps.description: Mix with a wooden spoon until well combined.

steps.headline: Fold in the chocolate chunks and chocolate chips.
Gently flatten the cookie dough using a wooden spoon.
Bake the skillet cookie for about 24-30 minutes, until the edges are golden brown and the chocolate melts.
steps.description: The inside of the skillet cookie will be slightly gooey after baking. This is normal and how the dessert is supposed to be eaten.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Scoop vanilla bean ice cream on top of the skillet cookie. Slice the cookie using a knife and enjoy eating it warm.

steps.headline: Combine the M&Ms together with the sugar cookie dough.
Fold in only 3 tablespoons of the sprinkles and mix until well combined.
Gently pat and spread sugar cookie dough down on an iron skillet.
Sprinkle the rest of the sprinkles over the skillet.
Bake the skillet cookie according to the package or recipe's directions.
steps.description: The edges should be golden brown and the M&Ms will slightly melt once fully cooked.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Scoop vanilla bean ice cream or extra M&Ms and sprinkles on top of the skillet cookie. Slice the cookie using a knife and enjoy eating it warm.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).
In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Crack in the eggs and add the vanilla.
steps.description: Blend until well combined.

steps.headline: Add the baking soda and salt and mix slowly until properly mixed.
Stir in the graham cracker crumbs and flour.
steps.description: Slowly mix until there are no more flour streaks and the cookie dough forms,

steps.headline: Fold in the milk chocolate and mix until properly combined.
Press down half of the cookie dough onto an iron skillet.
Sprinkle the mini marshmallows over the cookie dough.
Press down the rest of the cookie dough on top of the marshmallows.
Bake the cookie skillet in the oven for about 15 minutes.
Cut the jumbo marshmallows into thirds.
Top the cookie skillet with the jumbo marshmallows and bake for an additional 10 minutes.
steps.description: Bake until the marshmallows roast and turn slightly brown.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Scoop vanilla bean ice cream on top of the skillet cookie. Slice the cookie using a knife and enjoy eating it warm.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).
Cream the butter, maple extract, and both sugars.
steps.description: In a large bowl on medium-high speed with an electric mixer, cream the butter, extract, and both sugars until light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Crack in the eggs and add the molasses.
Pour in the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Add the baking soda, flour, salt, ginger, nutmeg, and cinnamon and slowly blend until the cookie dough forms.

steps.headline: Fold in the cinnamon chips and mix.
Press down the gingerbread cookie dough on an iron skillet.
Bake the cookie skillet for about 35-40 minutes, until the edges are golden brown.
Serve.
steps.description: Scoop vanilla bean ice cream on top of the skillet cookie and drizzle over some caramel sauce. Slice the cookie using a knife and enjoy eating it warm.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).
In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Crack in the egg and add the vanilla.
Stir in the dry ingredients and food coloring gel.
steps.description: Mix in the cocoa powder, flour, baking soda, salt, and food gel. Mix until the cookie dough forms and is a bright red color.

steps.headline: Fold in both chocolate chips and stir until well combined.
Press down the cookie dough onto an iron skillet.
Sprinkle more chocolate chips over the skillet.
Bake the cookie skillet for about 15-20 minutes, until the edges are golden brown and the chocolate melts.
Serve.
steps.description: Scoop vanilla bean ice cream on top of the skillet cookie and drizzle over some chocolate syrup. Slice the cookie using a knife and enjoy eating it warm.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).
Whisk the dry ingredients.
steps.description: In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt together until properly mixed.

steps.headline: Pour in both sugars, oil, vanilla, and egg and stir.
Fold in the chocolate chips and mix until cookie dough forms.
Press down the cookie dough onto an iron skillet.
Bake the cookie skillet for about 20 minutes, until the edges are golden brown and the chocolate melts.
Serve.
steps.description: Scoop vanilla bean ice cream on top of the skillet cookie and drizzle over some chocolate syrup. Slice the cookie using a knife and enjoy eating it warm.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).
Whisk the dry ingredients.
steps.description: In a large bowl, combine the baking powder, baking soda, flour, and salt together.

steps.headline: In a separate bowl, whisk the oil, milk, and both sugars.
Pour the flour mixture into the sugar mixture and mix well.
Fold in the chocolate chips with a wooden spoon until the cookie dough forms.
Press down the cookie dough onto an iron skillet.
Bake the cookie skillet for about 20-25 minutes, until the edges are golden brown and the chocolate melts.
Serve.
steps.description: Scoop vegan ice cream on top of the skillet cookie and drizzle over some chocolate syrup. Slice the cookie using a knife and enjoy eating it warm.

text: Chocolate Chip Skillet Cookie Preheat the oven to 325° Fahrenheit (162° Celsius).  Melt the butter. In an iron skillet, melt the butter on medium-high heat, stirring around with a rubber spatula. Continue to stir until it fully melts and bubbles slightly. Pour both sugars and stir. Mix until the mixture is glossy and smooth, resembling melted caramel. Shut off the stove and chill the mixture in the fridge until cool. Allow the mixture to chill for about 10-15 minutes. Remove the mixture from the fridge and crack in the eggs.  Stir in the vanilla, baking soda, flour, and salt. Mix with a wooden spoon until well combined. Fold in the chocolate chunks and chocolate chips.  Gently flatten the cookie dough using a wooden spoon.  Bake the skillet cookie for about 24-30 minutes, until the edges are golden brown and the chocolate melts. The inside of the skillet cookie will be slightly gooey after baking. This is normal and how the dessert is supposed to be eaten. Serve. Scoop vanilla bean ice cream on top of the skillet cookie. Slice the cookie using a knife and enjoy eating it warm. Skillet Sugar Cookie Combine the M&Ms together with the sugar cookie dough.  Fold in only 3 tablespoons of the sprinkles and mix until well combined.  Gently pat and spread sugar cookie dough down on an iron skillet.  Sprinkle the rest of the sprinkles over the skillet.  Bake the skillet cookie according to the package or recipe's directions. The edges should be golden brown and the M&Ms will slightly melt once fully cooked. Serve. Scoop vanilla bean ice cream or extra M&Ms and sprinkles on top of the skillet cookie. Slice the cookie using a knife and enjoy eating it warm. S'more Skillet Cookie Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).  In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.  Crack in the eggs and add the vanilla. Blend until well combined. Add the baking soda and salt and mix slowly until properly mixed.  Stir in the graham cracker crumbs and flour. Slowly mix until there are no more flour streaks and the cookie dough forms, Fold in the milk chocolate and mix until properly combined.  Press down half of the cookie dough onto an iron skillet.  Sprinkle the mini marshmallows over the cookie dough.  Press down the rest of the cookie dough on top of the marshmallows.  Bake the cookie skillet in the oven for about 15 minutes.  Cut the jumbo marshmallows into thirds.  Top the cookie skillet with the jumbo marshmallows and bake for an additional 10 minutes. Bake until the marshmallows roast and turn slightly brown. Serve. Scoop vanilla bean ice cream on top of the skillet cookie. Slice the cookie using a knife and enjoy eating it warm. Gingerbread Skillet Cookie Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).  Cream the butter, maple extract, and both sugars. In a large bowl on medium-high speed with an electric mixer, cream the butter, extract, and both sugars until light and fluffy. Crack in the eggs and add the molasses.  Pour in the dry ingredients. Add the baking soda, flour, salt, ginger, nutmeg, and cinnamon and slowly blend until the cookie dough forms. Fold in the cinnamon chips and mix.  Press down the gingerbread cookie dough on an iron skillet.  Bake the cookie skillet for about 35-40 minutes, until the edges are golden brown.  Serve. Scoop vanilla bean ice cream on top of the skillet cookie and drizzle over some caramel sauce. Slice the cookie using a knife and enjoy eating it warm. Red Velvet Skillet Cookie Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).  In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.  Crack in the egg and add the vanilla.  Stir in the dry ingredients and food coloring gel. Mix in the cocoa powder, flour, baking soda, salt, and food gel. Mix until the cookie dough forms and is a bright red color. Fold in both chocolate chips and stir until well combined.  Press down the cookie dough onto an iron skillet.  Sprinkle more chocolate chips over the skillet.  Bake the cookie skillet for about 15-20 minutes, until the edges are golden brown and the chocolate melts.  Serve. Scoop vanilla bean ice cream on top of the skillet cookie and drizzle over some chocolate syrup. Slice the cookie using a knife and enjoy eating it warm. Gluten-Free Skillet Cookie Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).  Whisk the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt together until properly mixed. Pour in both sugars, oil, vanilla, and egg and stir.  Fold in the chocolate chips and mix until cookie dough forms.  Press down the cookie dough onto an iron skillet.  Bake the cookie skillet for about 20 minutes, until the edges are golden brown and the chocolate melts.  Serve. Scoop vanilla bean ice cream on top of the skillet cookie and drizzle over some chocolate syrup. Slice the cookie using a knife and enjoy eating it warm. Vegan Skillet Cookie Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (176° Celsius).  Whisk the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, combine the baking powder, baking soda, flour, and salt together. In a separate bowl, whisk the oil, milk, and both sugars.  Pour the flour mixture into the sugar mixture and mix well.  Fold in the chocolate chips with a wooden spoon until the cookie dough forms.  Press down the cookie dough onto an iron skillet.  Bake the cookie skillet for about 20-25 minutes, until the edges are golden brown and the chocolate melts.  Serve. Scoop vegan ice cream on top of the skillet cookie and drizzle over some chocolate syrup. Slice the cookie using a knife and enjoy eating it warm.
